t: Hallelujah!*pn Sing*ln to the Lord*s a new song, his*ln praise in the assembly of the faithful.
Let*ln Israel celebrate its Maker; let*ln the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
Let*ln them praise his name with dancing and*ln make music to him with tambourine and lyre.
For*ln the Lord*s takes pleasure in his people; he*ln adorns the humble with salvation.
Let*ln the faithful celebrate in triumphal glory; let*ln them shout for joy on their beds.
Let*pn the exaltation of God be in their mouths and*ln a double-edged sword in their hands,
inflicting*ln vengeance on the nations and*ln punishment on the peoples,
binding*ln their kings with chains and*ln their dignitaries with iron shackles,
carrying*ln out the judgment decreed against them. This*ln honor is for all his faithful people. Hallelujah!*ln
